For how many ordered triples $ (x,y,z)$ of nonnegative integers less than $ 20$ are there exactly two distinct elements in the set $ \{i^x,(1 + i)^y,z\}$, where $ i = \sqrt { - 1}$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 149 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 205 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 215 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 225 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 235$
